question.title: First element in array of strings is empty when using split

node.contents: You are converting line to character array. You want to split the given line with space?

astNode.text: You are converting line to character array. You want to split the given line with space?

node.contents: Yes, the argument to `split(...)` is the (regex) delimiter. So if your input is eg. `1, 2, 4, 8` you could do `split( "," )`.'

astNode.text: Yes, the argument to `split(...)` is the (regex) delimiter. So if your input is eg. `1, 2, 4, 8` you could do `split( "," )`.'

node.contents: Ok, thank you very much, I will work with the delimiter now.

astNode.text: Ok, thank you very much, I will work with the delimiter now.

node.contents: So I'm trying to read some numbers from a file and put them into an array. I've been reading about people having problems with whitespace, so using trim, I did it like this:

astNode.text: So I'm trying to read some numbers from a file and put them into an array. I've been reading about people having problems with whitespace, so using trim, I did it like this:

elements.contents: String[] tokens = new String[length]; for(int i = 0; i<length;i++){ String line = fileReader.nextLine(); line = line.trim(); tokens = line.split(""); }

units.rawText: String[] tokens = new String[length]; for(int i = 0; i<length;i++){ String line = fileReader.nextLine(); line = line.trim(); tokens = line.split(""); }

node.contents: But the first element this array (token[0]) becomes empty. Am I using the split function wrong?

astNode.text: But the first element this array (token[0]) becomes empty. Am I using the split function wrong?

node.contents: Yeah! Thank you! Sometimes it's just right there in front of me!

astNode.text: Yeah! Thank you! Sometimes it's just right there in front of me!

node.contents: You need to tell the split method what character it should split on. Try this:

astNode.text: You need to tell the split method what character it should split on. Try this:

elements.contents: tokens = line.split(" "); //split on a space character

units.rawText: tokens = line.split(" "); //split on a space character
